content.raw:
I’m also encountering the same issue.  The clock offset seems to shift every time I relaunch Ignition Gazebo as well.  There seem to be different clocks published on /clock and sensor publishers have been confirmed to be referencing both separate clock times on the /clock topic.

‌

There seem to be a number of publishers on the ignition clock topic as well, this may be normal but it is something to look into:

> developer@arthur:~/subt\_ws$ ign topic -i -t /world/virtual\_stix/clock  
> Publishers \[Address, Message Type\]:  
> tcp://131.218.141.242:40004, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.229:34859, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.229:43381, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.229:43381, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.242:46454, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.111:32839, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.242:46375, ignition.msgs.Clock  
> tcp://131.218.141.242:46375, ignition.msgs.Clock
